summary: The American Energy Security Act of 2025 authorizes the Secretary of Transportation to provide grants for natural gas distribution pipeline infrastructure safety and modernization. Grants are available to publicly owned natural gas distribution pipeline systems to reduce leaks, incidents, and fatalities, and to accommodate alternative energy sources. The bill outlines eligible entities, application requirements, permitted uses for the grants, and considerations for awarding them. It also sets funding levels and mandates congressional notification before awarding grants, with an authorization of $200 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2029.
